main event: On October 25, 1955, a bright silver to white object was observed at Stewart AFB, New York for a duration of 30 minutes. It was described as round and the size of a silver dollar at arm's length.
interesting points: The object was initially thought to be a weather balloon, according to the intelligence officer who observed it.
The sighting was visually confirmed by the tower operations and an additional intelligence officer.
The observation lasted for an extended period of 30 minutes, allowing for detailed examination.
The object's appearance was described as bright silver to white in color, resembling a half dollar in size.
The sighting took place in unlimited visibility conditions, adding credibility to the observation.
sighted object: bright silver to white object, round in shape
